Crimes.Crime_Name: Illegal entry and stay in Canada
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can the Immigration Officer deny an H&C application based on the applicant's refusal to leave Canada after a removal order?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Section 25 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants stayed in Canada despite a removal order, arguing their establishment here should weigh positively.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: The Officer acted within discretion; staying illegally does not justify permanent residency under H&C grounds.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Permanent residency on humanitarian and compassionate (H&C) grounds
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review dismissed; Officer's decision upheld as reasonable.
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Voluntary disregard of legal removal order
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Family integration in Canada, risks in home country
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Undue hardship under Section 25 of IRPA
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Establishment in Canada, compliance with immigration laws
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Fettering discretion, fairness, consideration of children's best interests
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Evidence of establishment, family ties, risk in Argentina
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Degree of establishment, nature of non-compliance, risk upon return
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Section 25 allows H&C relief if undue hardship exists
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No unusual or disproportionate hardship found
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicants' refugee claim denied, leading to H&C application after remaining in Canada post-removal order
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer considered but gave little weight to establishment due to illegality
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations regarding removal orders
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: All factors considered, including children's best interests
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Illegal stay undermines H&C claim; no undue hardship established
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Undue, unusual, or disproportionate hardship under H&C provisions

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Immigration Officer's decision to deny H&C application was reasonable
Crimes.Governing_Law: Section 25 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants overstayed visas, had denied refugee claims, claimed H&C due to risks in Argentina and family integration in Canada.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Officer’s decision was reasonable; self-inflicted hardship did not meet H&C criteria.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Permanent residency on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review dismissed; Officer's decision upheld.
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Visa overstay with prior refugee claim denial
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Risk in Argentina, family and community ties in Canada
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Unusual, undeserved, or disproportionate hardship under Section 25
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Hardship assessment, best interests of children, establishment in Canada
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged failure to consider relevant factors, fairness concerns
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Evidence of family ties, duration of stay, conditions in Argentina
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Nature of hardship, degree of establishment, voluntariness of overstay
Crimes.Governing_Rule: H&C relief available if hardship is undue and not self-created
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Hardship deemed self-inflicted and not disproportionate
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicants overstayed visas and sought permanent residency on H&C grounds after unsuccessful refugee claims
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer assessed all factors including children's best interests
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPR sections related to authorized stay
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Hardship resulted from voluntary actions; does not meet H&C threshold
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Undue hardship standard under H&C provisions

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with removal order
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Immigration Officer's decision to deny H&C application was reasonable
Crimes.Governing_Law: Section 25 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants remained in Canada after removal order; cited emotional hardship, family ties, and risks in Argentina.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Decision was reasonable; no undue hardship established despite some positive factors.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Permanent residency on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review dismissed; Officer's decision upheld as reasonable.
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Removed persons who remained in Canada
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Emotional hardship, best interests of children, integration in Canada
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds under Section 25 requiring unusual or disproportionate hardship
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Establishment in Canada, risk on return, compliance history, children's best interests
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Challenged on grounds of fettered discretion and inadequate reasoning
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Evidence of family life, mental health impacts, conditions in Argentina
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: All relevant factors weighed, including negative impact of non-compliance
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Discretion under Section 25 must consider totality of circumstances
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No unusual or disproportionate hardship found despite emotional factors
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicants' refugee claim was denied, and their humanitarian and compassionate grounds application was rejected
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer acknowledged but assigned limited weight to establishment due to illegality
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Obligation to comply with removal order under IRPA
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant – failed to depart after removal order
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Balanced assessment including children's best interests
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Deliberate non-compliance reduces weight of positive factors; no justification for H&C relief
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Undue hardship under humanitarian and compassionate framework
